title: Workers at End of Day
content:

 May Oon

  shape: square (shape)

  materials_name: charcoal (material) cartridge paper

  techniques_name: painting (image-making)

  object_colour: charcoal (colour)

  physical_appearance: The image shows a square painting that is encased within a black frame. The painting is black-and-white. It featurers numerous men standing closely to one another. Three men in the foreground with clothes draped over their shoulders and necks are communicating with one another. One man is wearing a skullcap while another two are wearing straw hats. The men in the painting are either fully clothed or bare-chested. Most of them are wearing sarongs.Some of them are carrying items tied to sticks
 over their shoulders.

  subject_terms_1: immigrants labourers derivative works paintings (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Painting Charcoal drawing Singapore Blue collar workers Derivative works Immigrants

  subject_terms_3: Visual arts

  sgcool_label_text: This painting was first displayed by the artist May Oon at “Over/ Time” an exhibition organised by The Private Museum in 2015. It was created as part of a collection of primarily charcoal and oil works depicting the hardships of Chinese and Indian coolies in Singapore in the 1800s. The painting is inspired by archival photography available in the public domain
 as a reminder to Singapore’s public of their migrant roots.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This painting was first displayed by the artist May Oon at “Over/ Time” an exhibition organised by The Private Museum in 2015. It was created as part of a collection of primarily charcoal and oil works depicting the hardships of Chinese and Indian coolies in Singapore in the 1800s. The painting is inspired by archival photography available in the public domain, as a reminder to Singapore’s public of their migrant roots.
